result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melodie Monique Bell

defendant.name: Bell, Melodie Monique
defendant.address: 5200 North Lovers Lane Road #3, Milwaukee, WI 53224

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melodie Monique Bell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson appeared by video for Melodie Monique Bell.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: R. Lautenbach.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Anderson is in trial in another court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Scott Anderson

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION to entry made on 7-31-22.  The alternative bail for GPS monitoring is $1,250.00.

Court ordered no contact with Donita C.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,500.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. 24 hour curfew with the exception for verfied work, court appearances, medical appointments, and attorney appointments.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell in court with attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway.  Defendant Melodie Monique Bell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
